news.title: Trump exempts phones, computers, chips from new tariffs
news.summary: Financial markets have been roiled since President Trump imposed stiff tariffs on China. Apple and other tech companies make many of their products in China.

news.title: Trump tariffs on China will soon bring 'irreversible' damage to many American businesses
news.summary: Most businesses will soon face 'irreversible' damage from the trade war. Apple's iPhone and other tech got a reprieve from Trump's China tariffs policy.

news.title: Investors are growing concerned about a U.S. asset exodus as Treasuries and the dollar decline
news.summary: The combined decline of U.S. stocks, bonds and the dollar could be a sign of a broader shift away from investing in America.

news.title: Top Wall Street analysts find these 3 stocks attractive in these challenging times
news.summary: TipRanks' analyst ranking service highlights three stocks favored by the Street's top pros. Affirm Holdings and TJX Companies are two of the names on the list.

news.title: These are the 10 hottest U.S. neighborhoods for 2025, new data shows—5 are in the Midwest
news.summary: Redfin ranked the most populous metro areas by year-over-year growth in listing views. Redfin: Los Angeles, San Francisco, New York and Washington are the most popular cities for homebuyers.

news.title: I held power of attorney for my late brother. Can I withdraw money from his bank account to give to his favorite charity?
news.summary: ‘He honestly believed the power of attorney was also the beneficiary of this account, so a beneficiary was not listed’ said a spokesman.

news.title: ‘I’ve made the most money over the last 30 years buying solid companies in terrible markets’: Should I start buying?
news.summary: “As the old phrase goes, don’t catch a falling knife,” he says. “As an old phrase, don't catch a fall knife.”

news.title: I’m administrator of my sister’s estate. Her bank won’t tell me the names of her beneficiaries. Is that legal?
news.summary: “They told me that the beneficiaries know who they are, which is not the case,” she says. “They said that the beneficiary know who the are,’ she adds. � “I’m not sure that’s true.”

news.title: This is the future of senior housing
news.summary: Older consumers have more education and higher technological expectations. Older consumers — and their adult children — now have more technology expectations. More and more technology is available to older consumers.

news.title: If millions of dead people are stealing from Social Security, then why can’t the DOJ find any of them?
news.summary: The ‘dead people collecting Social Security’ narrative just won’t die, says CNN’s John Sutter. Sutter: Social Security is supposed to be a safety net, not a way of life.
